com.mapquest.android.maps
Interface Projection

public interface Projection

Projection class translates pixel coordinates on the screen to latitude and longitude degrees on earth's surface and vice versa. To obtain the projection class instance, use MapView.getProjection().

Method Summary
 GeoPoint fromPixels(int x, int y)
          Translates pixel coordinates x and y on the screen to latitude and longitude on earth's surface
 float metersToEquatorPixels(float meters)
          Converts the distance in meters to screen pixels size at current zoom level.
 android.graphics.Point toPixels(GeoPoint in, android.graphics.Point out)
          Translates location on earth's surface (GeoPoint) to pixel coordinates on the screen.
 

Method Detail

fromPixels

GeoPoint fromPixels(int x,
                    int y)
Translates pixel coordinates x and y on the screen to latitude and longitude on earth's surface

Parameters:
x - the x location on the screen
y - the y location on the screen
Returns:
geoPoint the latitude and longitude degrees on the earth's surface.

metersToEquatorPixels

float metersToEquatorPixels(float meters)
Converts the distance in meters to screen pixels size at current zoom level.

Parameters:
meters - the distance in meters
Returns:
number of pixels on the screen for specified meters

toPixels

android.graphics.Point toPixels(GeoPoint in,
                                android.graphics.Point out)
Translates location on earth's surface (GeoPoint) to pixel coordinates on the screen.

Parameters:
in - the location on the earth's surface to translate
out - an optional Point instance to reuse. If not null, sets the translated values onto this instance and returns the same.
Returns:
the pixels coordinates on the screen
